result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald L Metz

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant Ronald L Metz in court.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Ronald L Metz.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Reading of complaint waived. Charges and penalties explained by the court. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendants Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronald L Metz in court.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Defendant would like to talk with SPD. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Complaint read by court. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH AMERICINN IN ELKHORN, WI. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Ronald L Metz in court, in custody by video. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State. Attorney Obi Uzowulu for defendant. Defendant did not complete pretrial questionnaire. Cash bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
